definitions.text: spoken with poor articulation as if with a thick tongue
examples: after a few drinks he was beginning to speak thickly
old houses are often so densely packed that perhaps three or four have to be demolished for every new one built

definitions.text: with thickness; in a thick manner
examples: spread 1/4 lb softened margarine or cooking fat fairly thickly all over the surface
we were visiting a small, thickly walled and lovely town with straggling outskirt
